Plot the median cluster copy number distribution of putative LTR transposons for several species

Source: R/plot_copynumber_species.R
plot_copynumber_species.Rd

Visualize the correlation between LTR transposon age (measured in LTR similarity) and the median cluster copy number of the corresponding LTR retrotransposon (the complete sequence) or the width of the left LTR element for each species stored in the input data.

plot_copynumber_species(data, element.type = "full_retrotransposon",
  plot.type = "boxplot", similarity.bin = 2, min.sim = 70,
  quality.filter = FALSE, n.orfs = 0, include.unique = FALSE,
  xlab = "LTR % Similarity", ylab = "Median Copy Number", main = "",
  legend.title = "Similarity between LTRs", arrow_lab = FALSE,
  y.ticks = 10)

Arguments

data

the data.frame generated by LTRpred.
element.type

which width shall be visualized. Full retrotransposon width or only LTR element cluster copy number: choose element.type = "full_retrotransposon" or element.type = "ltr_element". In case element.type = "ltr_element" is chosen then the width of the left LTR element is used to visualize width vs. seq. similarity between the LTRs.
plot.type

type of visualization: either plot.type = "boxplot" or plot.type = "violin".
similarity.bin

resolution of similarity binning. E.g. binning 98%-100% into 0.5% intervals would be similarity.bin = 0.5.
min.sim

minimum similarity between LTRs that can shall be considered for visualization.
quality.filter

shall false positives be filtered out as much as possible or not. See Description for details.
n.orfs

minimum number of ORFs detected in the putative LTR transposon.
include.unique

shall unique elements be visualized together with the clusters?
xlab

label of x-axis.
ylab

label of y-axis.
main

title label.
legend.title

title of legend.
arrow_lab

whether or not data points shall be labelled with arrows (ggrepel).
y.ticks

number of ticks at the y-axis. Default is y.ticks = 10.

Details

This function visualizes the correlation between LTR transposon age (measured in LTR similarity) and the cluster copy number of the corresponding LTR retrotransposon (the complete sequence) or the width of the left LTR element. Using this visualization approach, different classes of LTR retrotransposons can be detected due to their width and age correlation.

Examples

# NOT RUN {
# }
